text: Karate belts are a measure of a student/teacher ability. For example, a Brown belt is higher than a Blue Belt.http://www.allkarate.com/125/history-of- karate-belt-colors == Usual rank == All styles of karate range from white to black.Karate Belt Colors. Retrieved May 25, 2010. There are some theories about how belts came to be. === The "dying" theory === Some believe when a student graduated a kyu, he/she would dye their current belt the new, desired color.Karate Belt Dying. Retrieved June 21, 2010. This was often done in Japan during WWII when it was a very poor country. === The "dirty belt" theory === This is a theory that demonstrates how a student would, as they trained, dirty their belt overtime. More of a myth than a theory,The Dirty Belt Theory. Retrieved September 6, 2010. a student started with a white belt. As sweat, dirt, and other debris occupied not only the belt, but the karate gi, his/her color appeared to get darker and closer to black.http://www.answers.com/Dirty_Belt_Theory == References == belts Category:Sports clothing
